CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Mihai Poalelungi;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed an action for distribution of matrimonial property with ORG .
CARDINAL . Following ORG finding ( see below ) ORG held CARDINAL hearings , obtained further evidence and an expert opinion .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG delivered a judgment which became final on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found that ORG had violated the applicant 's right under CARDINAL LAW to a hearing without unjustified delay . The overall length of the proceedings ( DATE at a single instance ) was clearly inappropriate . The applicant had contributed to the length of the proceedings to a certain extent in that she had failed to appear at hearings on CARDINAL occasions .

CARDINAL . The Constitutional Court awarded the equivalent of CARDINAL euros ( ORG ) at that time to the applicant as just satisfaction in respect of non - pecuniary damage . It also ordered ORG to avoid any further delay in the proceedings and to reimburse the applicant 's legal costs .
